headline: Creamy au Gratin Potatoes
description: Au gratin potatoes made with thinly sliced potatoes and onions baked in a decadently rich and creamy Cheddar cheese sauce until tender and bubbling.

video.name: Creamy Au Gratin Potatoes

name: Creamy au Gratin Potatoes
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Butter a 1-quart casserole dish.

Layer 1/2 of the potatoes in the bottom of the prepared casserole dish; season with salt and pepper. Layer onion slices over top, then top with with remaining potatoes. Season again with salt and pepper.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Gradually whisk in flour and salt and cook, whisking constantly until raw flour flavor has cooked off, about 1 minute. Gradually add milk, about 1/4 cup at a time, whisking well after each addition to incorporate; the gradual addition and whisking of milk will help avoid lumps in your sauce.

Cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture has thickened, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in cheese all at once; continue stirring until melted, 30 to 60 seconds. Pour cheese sauce over the potatoes, and cover the dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are tender and sauce is bubbly, about 1 1/2 hours.

review.reviewBody: This was great! Everyone loved it. I followed the recipe exactly except chopped the onions as others suggested. I also uncovered for the last 20+ mins to have it golden. Yum! A food processor makes this meal prep a breeze! (Slicing potatoes thinly, shredding cheese, and chopping onions) Thanks for the recipe!
Delicious! Made as directed. Cooked additional 15-20 min without foil to get a little brown on top.

I caramelized the thinly-sliced onion rings in butter (ghee, actually) first, then added the flour and gradually stirred in the milk. Then I added salt, pepper, 1 cup of cheddar and 1 cup of Swiss cheese. I layered the thinly-sliced potatoes in a buttered casserole and poured the sauce on top. I used a fork to lift the top potatoes so that the sauce covered all layers. Then I topped it with more grated cheddar. I baked it with the casserole lid on for the first 50 minutes and then removed the lid and baked it for another 20 minutes. Absolutely delicious!
I added paprika to the top before baking.
Love for Sunday dinner with the family.
This has become a family favourite! Creamy, cheesy and delicious!

Placed in oven at 400 for 40-45 min to allow onion and cheese to do its thing. Came out great. Will make again for sure.
Was definitely delicious!
Made this recipe for company, every drop was eaten. I followed other users advise and cut the onions smaller. Uncovered dish for last half hour. Delicious and will definitely make again!

This dish turned out exactly the way I was hoping for. I read several Au Gratin recipes and chose this one for its simplicity. I used Russet potatoes and changed the 2 cups of milk to 1/2 & 1/2 milk plus 1/4 cup whole milk. I changed the flour to 1/3 level cup. I wanted to be sure there was plenty of Bechamel to make the potatoes extra creamy. I buttered the baking dish and put 1/2 cup Bechamel on the bottom of the pan. Then I put in a layer of 1/8" sliced potatoes, a layer of onions thinly sliced and roughly chopped onions and 1/4 cup shredded Mexican blend cheese (that's all I had on hand). Start each layer with Bechamel. I made 3 layers all together and topped it all with the remaining Bechamel and 1/2 cup cheese. Bake at 400 on middle rack for 30 minutes then turn it around so it will cook evenly, and cook for another 30 minutes, remove the foil, and bake another 20 minutes. It was divine!
YUMMY!!
Although I should‚Äôve used a slightly larger pan, I followed the recipe to the ‚ÄúT!‚Äù It was awesome! Thank youüòä

Also, definitely recommend cooking uncovered for the last 30 mins to brown the top nicely. I cooked mine at 425¬∞ for 1.5 hours but i also used a deeper dish and had 4 or 5 layers (onions sprinkled between each layer).

I made this for New Year's Eve lunch to go along with beef tenderloin, and creamed spinach. Whole family, including me, LOVED them. I try not to change up people's recipes too much. Since I had 7 people, I just kept slicing potatoes on my mandoline until I had enough for 3 layers. Minced onion super fine and spread over first 2 layers. I doubled sauce recipe and used a combo of whole milk and cream as well as a combo of Swiss and Cheddar. Also, I baked it the night before and just warmed up in over for about 20 minutes to get top nice and brown and bubbly. Excellent potato dish, but it won't help you lose any weight! :-)
Next time will pre-cook potatoes half way in microwave so cooking will not take 1 1/2 hrs. Good recipe!!

Delicious! I sauted the onions for a few minutes and that was a nice addition. Used half sharp cheese. Don‚Äôt use skim milk or add more flour to make it thicker. Spray the Pyrex first - they stick bad if you don‚Äôt.

I liked the recipe as a base.... My upgrades: caramelized the onions... added chopped cooked bacon... seasoned potatoes with salt, garlic granules, black pepper... last 20 mins uncovered and topped with a breadcrumb, garlic, and parmesan mixture... finished baking until topping was browned... turned out delish! P.S. "sliced thin" means thin... based on any au gratin I've ever had, I would never go thicker than 1/8 of an inch! If you don't have a fancy gadget, the best option outside of using a nice sharp knife is the "slicing" side of a cheese grater... works great! For a richer roux, I slightly brown it before adding liquid!

I liked this basic recipe. Some comments that it was flavorless depends on your tastes IMO. So, I added a dusting of garlic powder, onion powder, Hungarian paprika, and a small amount of chili powder to the potatoes before adding the sauce. Sprinkling this preparation on each level of the build. Then, after cooking let it rest overnight before reheating and serving the next day. My one critic of this recipe is the covering of the potatoes does not allow browning, even in a 400 degree oven for 1.5 hours. So when I reheated, I left the foil off. Absolutely creamy and delicious.
Perfect, just what I was hoping for! I did add about a TBSP minced garlic, used Panela and sharp cheddar and lots of pepper. Very good. Allrecipes is #1 in my book.

This was very good. My whole family enjoyed it which is a huge deal in my household. After reading comments I did something I usually don't do and made changes to the original recipe on my 1st try. Sorry! I know I don't like it when others rate a recipe based on a bunch of changes but it was a good base! I used sharp cheddar (reserving some to add on top at end of cooking), added 1/2 tsp of ground dry mustard, 1/2 tsp of garlic powder and pepper to taste to the salt that was whisked into the flour/butter mixture. Used heavy cream instead of milk (bc I needed to use it up). I used my food processor to slice the potatoes thin and fast! Chopped the onions and caramelized. Chopped bacon and cooked it and sprinkled it on top at end for garnish with dried chives. Removed from oven at 1 hr and 15 min. Added reserved cheese and broiled a tad. The edges browned quite a bit. One more thing, if your review states the recipe is bland it's the cheese you're using. Try sharp or extra sharp cheddar. If you use a mild cheese, your dish will be bland. This recipe is a keeper.

I made this delicious creamy potato dish FIVE times since I first came upon it three weeks ago. I reduced the liquid mixture which avoided overflow while baking. I used 1 C milk and 1/3 C chicken broth; total 1 1/3C. I, also, lightly topped the casserole with a mixture of bread crumbs, panko, and grated cheese. Do check your potatoes for doneness with a knife; you may need to leave it in a little longer depending on your oven. Let it sit a while before you dive in because it is piping hot and so delicious you don't want to burn your mouth like I did the first time! Winner winner! Really good!!

*COOKING SHORTCUT*
Instead of baking for 1 1/2 hours, bake for 45 minutes (still at 400 F), then broil on high for 15-20 minutes.

We made this recipe as part of our Christmas dinner. I didn‚Äôt care for it for several reasons. I can see where it might be a good recipe if I modified it but I didn‚Äôt since it was my first time making it. I found there to be too much onion and too much cheese sauce. I was overwhelmed by the rich thick creamy sauce. I will lighten it up if I make it again. I would use a sharper cheese but less of it since it will have more flavor. I would also cut the onion in half and slice it very thin. I think putting it in a more shallow baking pan will help too.
Made it Christmas morning. Turned out great and it was delicious!!

I've made this a few times, people have 2nd helpings. I clean the potatoes carefully, peal and them slice on a mandoline. 5 medium large potatoes does the trick. I also slice the onions on the mandoline, just as thick. And I love onions, I use 1 or 1 1/2 medium white/yellow onions. Salt and pepper on both layers of potato.

Use a 2 inch or deeper glass/ceramic baking dish. Too shallow and it can burn/get crunchy.

Cheese sauce, I use /2 milk and 1/2 heavy cream to cut down on lactose. and at least 1-2 cups of cheese, according to taste. 

Cook at 400 for 1 hour and test a potato and a shred of onion. Done when tender.

200 grams of gouda make the best you've ever had, 300 grams is even better.

I've also made it with Monterrey Jack, yellow cheddar, and white cheddar. Pick your cheese. It'll be delicious.
